info.description:
Functions and constants to access the window, window event listeners
and screen dimming.
info.name: Window

parameters.doc:
A callback which receives info about window events. Pass an empty function or nil if you no longer wish to receive callbacks.
self
object The calling script
event
constant The type of event. Can be one of these:
  • window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_LOST
  • window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED
  • window.WINDOW_EVENT_RESIZED
  • window.WINDOW_EVENT_ICONIFIED
  • window.WINDOW_EVENT_DEICONIFIED
data
table The callback value data is a table which currently holds these values
  • number width: The width of a resize event. nil otherwise.
  • number height: The height of a resize event. nil otherwise.
parameters.name: callback

elements.examples:
function window_callback(self, event, data)
    if event == window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_LOST then
        print("window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_LOST")
    elseif event == window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED then
        print("window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED")
    elseif event == window.WINDOW_EVENT_ICONFIED then
        print("window.WINDOW_EVENT_ICONFIED")
    elseif event == window.WINDOW_EVENT_DEICONIFIED then
        print("window.WINDOW_EVENT_DEICONIFIED")
    elseif event == window.WINDOW_EVENT_RESIZED then
        print("Window resized: ", data.width, data.height)
    end
end

function init(self)
    window.set_listener(window_callback)
end
elements.name: window.set_listener

elements.description: Sets the dimming mode on a mobile device. The dimming mode specifies whether or not a mobile device should dim the screen after a period without user interaction. The dimming mode will only affect the mobile device while the game is in focus on the device, but not when the game is running in the background. This function has no effect on platforms that does not support dimming.
elements.brief: set the mode for screen dimming
elements.name: window.set_dim_mode

elements.description: Returns the current dimming mode set on a mobile device. The dimming mode specifies whether or not a mobile device should dim the screen after a period without user interaction. On platforms that does not support dimming, window.DIMMING_UNKNOWN is always returned.
elements.brief: get the mode for screen dimming
elements.name: window.get_dim_mode

elements.description: This returns the current window size (width and height).
elements.name: window.get_size

elements.description: This event is sent to a window event listener when the game window or app screen has lost focus.
elements.name: window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_LOST

elements.description:
This event is sent to a window event listener when the game window or app screen has
gained focus.
This event is also sent at game startup and the engine gives focus to the game.
elements.name: window.WINDOW_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED

elements.description:
This event is sent to a window event listener when the game window or app screen is resized.
The new size is passed along in the data field to the event listener.
elements.name: window.WINDOW_EVENT_RESIZED

elements.description: This event is sent to a window event listener when the game window or app screen is iconified (reduced to an application icon in a toolbar, application tray or similar).
elements.name: window.WINDOW_EVENT_ICONFIED

elements.description: This event is sent to a window event listener when the game window or app screen is restored after being iconified.
elements.name: window.WINDOW_EVENT_DEICONIFIED

elements.description: Dimming mode is used to control whether or not a mobile device should dim the screen after a period without user interaction.
elements.name: window.DIMMING_ON

elements.description: Dimming mode is used to control whether or not a mobile device should dim the screen after a period without user interaction.
elements.name: window.DIMMING_OFF

elements.description:
Dimming mode is used to control whether or not a mobile device should dim the screen after a period without user interaction.
This mode indicates that the dim mode can't be determined, or that the platform doesn't support dimming.
elements.name: window.DIMMING_UNKNOWN
